required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Single Dose Pharmacokinetics of Two and Proof of Efficacy of One New Etoricoxib Gel Formulation in Participants With Osteoarthritis (MK-0663-168)
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Assess the Single Dose Pharmacokinetics of Two and Proof of Efficacy of One New Etoricoxib Gel Formulation in Osteoarthritis Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Study Part 1 is designed to assess the plasma pharmacokinetics of etoricoxib (ETOR) 4% dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) and propylene glycol (PG) formulations, each at 2 different doses, upon single-dose topical administration on the knee of osteoarthritis participants. Study Part 2 is designed to evaluate the efficacy of topical etoricoxib vs. placebo in the treatment of osteoarthritis of the knee. The primary hypothesis is that topical etoricoxib will be more effective than placebo in the treatment of osteoarthritis of the knee over 2 weeks of treatment as assessed by time-weighted average change from baseline on the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis Index (WOMAC) Visual Analogue (VA) 3.0 pain subscale.

detailed_description.textblock: Part I of the study will consist of a single-dose, open-label, randomized, four-way cross over study with topical administration of etoricoxib gel on the knee of osteoarthritis participants. The washout between successive dose administrations will be at least one week. Part 2 of the study will consist of double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled, parallel groups, multiple dose, twice daily topical administration of etoricoxib or placebo gel on the knee of osteoarthritis participants for a period of two weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Study Part 1: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of ETOR After Single Dosing
primary_outcome.description: Cmax determined for the period up to 72 hours post-single application. Descriptive statistics are expressed as the geometric least squares mean (GLSM). Cmax with value 0 included in calculation of GLSMs with a value of 0.5*LLOQ (=0.5 h*ng/ml).

primary_outcome.measure: Study Part 1: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of ETOR After Single Dosing
primary_outcome.description: Tmax determined for the period up to 72 hours post-single application.

primary_outcome.measure: Study Part 1: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of ETOR From Time 0 to Last (AUC0-last) After Single Dosing
primary_outcome.description: Area under the observed concentration-time curve from time zero to the last quantifiable time point determined for the period up to 72 hours post-single application. The area was calculated according to the linear up/log down trapezoidal rule. AUC0-last is an estimate of total plasma exposure. Descriptive statistics are expressed as the GLSM. AUC with value 0 included in calculation of GLSMs with a value of 0.5*LLOQ (=0.5 h*ng/ml).

primary_outcome.measure: Study Part 2: Change From Baseline in Mean Participant Score on the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis Index (WOMAC) Visual Analog (VA) 3.1 Pain Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day -1), Day 2, Day 4, Day 7, Day 11, Day 14
primary_outcome.description: The WOMAC VA 3.1 Pain subscale is a self-administered questionnaire assessing lower extremity pain due to osteoarthritis that was completed by participants 2 to 3 hours post morning dose. The WOMAC Pain Subscale had five questions with answers to each item assessed on a 100 mm VA scale (0 = no pain; 100 = extreme pain). The score for each item was summed and the overall score ranged from 0 to 500 (increasing severity). The time weighted average up to day x was calculated as the sum of rectangles under the curve for successive intervals prior to day x as defined by timepoints at which assessments were made. The time weighted change from baseline was calculated. A negative mean change from baseline indicates improvement in pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Study Part 2: Change From Baseline in Mean Participant Score on the WOMAC VA 3.1 Stiffness Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day -1), Day 2, Day 4, Day 7, Day 11, Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: The WOMAC VA 3.1 Stiffness subscale is a self-administered questionnaire assessing lower extremity stiffness due to osteoarthritis that was completed by participants 2 to 3 hours post morning dose. The WOMAC Stiffness subscale had two questions with answers to each item assessed on a 100 mm VA scale (0 = no stiffness; 100 = extreme stiffness). The score for each item was summed and the overall score ranged from 0 to 200 (increasing severity). The time weighted average up to day x was calculated as the sum of rectangles under the curve for successive intervals prior to day x as defined by timepoints at which assessments were made. The time weighted change from baseline was calculated. A negative mean change from baseline indicates improvement in stiffness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Study Part 2: Change From Baseline in Mean Participant Score on the WOMAC VA 3.1 Physical Functioning Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day -1), Day 2, Day 4, Day 7, Day 11, Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: The WOMAC VA 3.1 Physical Functioning subscale is a self-administered questionnaire assessing lower extremity physical function due to osteoarthritis that was completed by participants 2 to 3 hours post morning dose. The WOMAC Physical Functioning subscale had 17 questions with answers to each item assessed on a 100 mm VA scale (0 = no difficulty; 100 = extreme difficulty). The score for each item was summed and the overall score ranged from 0 to 1700 (increasing severity). The time weighted average up to day x was calculated as the sum of rectangles under the curve for successive intervals prior to day x as defined by timepoints at which assessments were made. The time weighted change from baseline was calculated. A negative mean change from baseline indicates improvement in physical function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Study Part 2: Percentage of Participants by Category on Patient Global Assessment of Response to Therapy (PGART)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 2, Day 4, Day 7, Day 11, Day 14, post-trial (up to Day 28)
secondary_outcome.description: The PGART is a self-administered questionnaire completed by participants. Participant assessment of response of arthritis to study medication was assessed on a 5-point Likert scale ('very well', 'well', 'fair', 'poor', and 'very poor').

secondary_outcome.measure: Study Parts 1 and 2: Number of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study Part 1: up to Day 47; Study Part 2: up to Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Study Parts 1 and 2: Number of Participants Who Discontinued Study Drug Due to an Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study Part 1: up to Day 47; Study Part 2: up to Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pt 1: ETOR 75 DMSO/ETOR 150 PG/ETOR 75 PG/ETOR 150 DMSO
arm_group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (1.97 mL) 4% DMSO gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (4.30 mL) 4% PG gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (2.15 mL) 4% PG gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (3.94 mL) 4% DMSO gel. All treatments were applied topically.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pt 1: ETOR 75 PG/ETOR 75 DMSO/ETOR 150 DMSO/ETOR 150 PG
arm_group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (2.15 mL) 4% PG gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (1.97 mL) 4% DMSO gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (3.94 mL) 4% DMSO gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (4.30 mL) 4% PG gel. All treatments were applied topically.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pt 1: ETOR 150 DMSO/ETOR 75 PG/ETOR 150 PG/ETOR 75 DMSO
arm_group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (3.94 mL) 4% DMSO gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (2.15 mL) 4% PG gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (4.30 mL) 4% PG gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (1.97 mL) 4% DMSO gel. All treatments were applied topically.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pt 1: ETOR 150 PG/ETOR 150 DMSO/ETOR 75 PG/ETOR 75 DMSO
arm_group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (4.30 mL) 4% PG gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (3.94 mL) 4% DMSO gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (1.97 mL) 4% DMSO gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (2.15 mL) 4% PG gel. All treatments were applied topically.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pt 1: ETOR OD/ ETOR 150 DMSO/ ETOR 75 DMSO/ ETOR 75 PG
arm_group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 163 mg (4.30 mL) 4% DMSO gel (DMSO formulation administered in error/overdose [OD]), followed by single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (3.94 mL) 4% DMSO gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (1.97 mL) 4% DMSO gel, followed by single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (2.15 mL) 4% PG gel. All treatments were applied topically.

Participants randomized to a treatment sequence in Part 1 who received single dose placebo gel (1.97 or 3.94 mL) applied topically in error instead of active study drug and dropped out after the first treatment period in the sequence. Included in the safety assessments only.
Etoricoxib 50 mg (1.31 mL, 4% DMSO gel) applied topically twice daily to the affected knee for a period of 2 weeks.
Matching placebo to etoricoxib 50 mg 1.31 mL 4% DMSO gel applied topically twice daily to the affected knee for a period of 2 weeks.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were screened for inclusion in the study over 4 weeks prior to first treatment. Two additional participants were screened for Study Part 1 but not randomized or treated due to screen failure.

outcome.title: Study Part 1: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of ETOR After Single Dosing
outcome.description: Cmax determined for the period up to 72 hours post-single application. Descriptive statistics are expressed as the geometric least squares mean (GLSM). Cmax with value 0 included in calculation of GLSMs with a value of 0.5*LLOQ (=0.5 h*ng/ml).
outcome.population: PK analysis set defined as all participants treated with etoricoxib with sufficient PK data for reliable estimation of the PK parameter of interest (Cmax) without any protocol violation that interferes with PK data interpretation

group.title: ETOR 75 DMSO
group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (1.97 mL) 4% DMSO gel applied topically.

group.title: ETOR 75 PG
group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (2.15 mL) 4% PG gel applied topically.

group.title: Placebo (Pt 1) (Deviation)
group.description: Single dose placebo (1.97 mL or 3.94 mL) gel applied topically (placebo gel administered in error instead of active study drug formulation).

measure.title: Study Part 1: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of ETOR After Single Dosing
measure.description: Cmax determined for the period up to 72 hours post-single application. Descriptive statistics are expressed as the geometric least squares mean (GLSM). Cmax with value 0 included in calculation of GLSMs with a value of 0.5*LLOQ (=0.5 h*ng/ml).
measure.population: PK analysis set defined as all participants treated with etoricoxib with sufficient PK data for reliable estimation of the PK parameter of interest (Cmax) without any protocol violation that interferes with PK data interpretation

analysis.groups_desc: The geometric least squares mean ratio (GLSMR) and 90% confidence interval was calculated for Cmax after log transformation for the formulation comparison (ETOR 75 DMSO/ETOR 75 PG) using a linear mixed effect model with fixed effects terms for treatment and period and random effect for participants. Cmax with value 0 included in calculation of GLSMs with a value of 0.5*LLOQ (=0.5 h*ng/ml).

The GLSMR and 90% confidence interval was calculated for Cmax after log transformation for the formulation comparison (ETOR 150 DMSO/ETOR 150 PG) using a linear mixed effect model with fixed effects terms for treatment and period and random effect for participants. Cmax with value 0 included in calculation of GLSMs with a value of 0.5*LLOQ (=0.5 h*ng/ml).

The GLSMR and 90% confidence interval was calculated for Cmax after log transformation for the dose comparison (ETOR 75 DMSO/ETOR 150 DMSO) using a linear mixed effect model with fixed effects terms for treatment and period and random effect for participants. Cmax with value 0 included in calculation of GLSMs with a value of 0.5*LLOQ (=0.5 h*ng/ml).

The GLSMR and 90% confidence interval was calculated for Cmax after log transformation for the dose comparison (ETOR 75 PG/ETOR 150 PG) using a linear mixed effect model with fixed effects terms for treatment and period and random effect for participants. Cmax with value 0 included in calculation of GLSMs with a value of 0.5*LLOQ (=0.5 h*ng/ml).

outcome.title: Study Part 1: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of ETOR After Single Dosing
outcome.description: Tmax determined for the period up to 72 hours post-single application.
outcome.population: PK analysis set defined as all participants treated with etoricoxib with sufficient PK data for reliable estimation of the PK parameter of interest (Tmax) without any protocol violation that interferes with PK data interpretation

outcome.title: Study Part 2: Change From Baseline in Mean Participant Score on the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis Index (WOMAC) Visual Analog (VA) 3.1 Pain Scale
outcome.description: The WOMAC VA 3.1 Pain subscale is a self-administered questionnaire assessing lower extremity pain due to osteoarthritis that was completed by participants 2 to 3 hours post morning dose. The WOMAC Pain Subscale had five questions with answers to each item assessed on a 100 mm VA scale (0 = no pain; 100 = extreme pain). The score for each item was summed and the overall score ranged from 0 to 500 (increasing severity). The time weighted average up to day x was calculated as the sum of rectangles under the curve for successive intervals prior to day x as defined by timepoints at which assessments were made. The time weighted change from baseline was calculated. A negative mean change from baseline indicates improvement in pain.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day -1), Day 2, Day 4, Day 7, Day 11, Day 14
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) defined as all treated participants (etoricoxib or placebo) without major entry criteria violation and with at least one valid post-baseline primary efficacy assessment

group.title: ETOR 50 DMSO
group.description: Etoricoxib 50 mg (1.31 mL, 4% DMSO gel) applied topically twice daily to the affected knee for a period of 2 weeks.

measure.title: Study Part 2: Change From Baseline in Mean Participant Score on the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis Index (WOMAC) Visual Analog (VA) 3.1 Pain Scale
measure.description: The WOMAC VA 3.1 Pain subscale is a self-administered questionnaire assessing lower extremity pain due to osteoarthritis that was completed by participants 2 to 3 hours post morning dose. The WOMAC Pain Subscale had five questions with answers to each item assessed on a 100 mm VA scale (0 = no pain; 100 = extreme pain). The score for each item was summed and the overall score ranged from 0 to 500 (increasing severity). The time weighted average up to day x was calculated as the sum of rectangles under the curve for successive intervals prior to day x as defined by timepoints at which assessments were made. The time weighted change from baseline was calculated. A negative mean change from baseline indicates improvement in pain.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS) defined as all treated participants (etoricoxib or placebo) without major entry criteria violation and with at least one valid post-baseline primary efficacy assessment

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment difference in mean time-weighted average change from baseline to Day 2 in the WOMAC VA 3.1 pain subscale score (ETOR 50 DMSO - Placebo [Pt 2]) was evaluated using a constrained longitudinal data analysis model that included baseline measurements and time-weighted average at Day 2 in the response variable. The model included terms of visit, visit-by-treatment, and treatment.

Treatment difference in mean time-weighted average change from baseline to Day 4 in the WOMAC VA 3.1 pain subscale score (ETOR 50 DMSO - Placebo [Pt 2]) was evaluated using a constrained longitudinal data analysis model that included baseline measurements and time-weighted average at Day 4 in the response variable. The model included terms of visit, visit-by-treatment, and treatment.

Treatment difference in mean time-weighted average change from baseline to Day 7 in the WOMAC VA 3.1 pain subscale score (ETOR 50 DMSO - Placebo [Pt 2]) was evaluated using a constrained longitudinal data analysis model that included baseline measurements and time-weighted average at Day 7 in the response variable. The model included terms of visit, visit-by-treatment, and treatment.

Treatment difference in mean time-weighted average change from baseline to Day 11 in the WOMAC VA 3.1 pain subscale score (ETOR 50 DMSO - Placebo [Pt 2]) was evaluated using a constrained longitudinal data analysis model that included baseline measurements and time-weighted average at Day 11 in the response variable. The model included terms of visit, visit-by-treatment, and treatment.

Treatment difference in mean time-weighted average change from baseline to Day 14 in the WOMAC VA 3.1 pain subscale score (ETOR 50 DMSO - Placebo [Pt 2]) was evaluated using a constrained longitudinal data analysis model that included baseline measurements and time-weighted average at Day 14 in the response variable. The model included terms of visit, visit-by-treatment, and treatment.

outcome.title: Study Part 2: Change From Baseline in Mean Participant Score on the WOMAC VA 3.1 Stiffness Scale
outcome.description: The WOMAC VA 3.1 Stiffness subscale is a self-administered questionnaire assessing lower extremity stiffness due to osteoarthritis that was completed by participants 2 to 3 hours post morning dose. The WOMAC Stiffness subscale had two questions with answers to each item assessed on a 100 mm VA scale (0 = no stiffness; 100 = extreme stiffness). The score for each item was summed and the overall score ranged from 0 to 200 (increasing severity). The time weighted average up to day x was calculated as the sum of rectangles under the curve for successive intervals prior to day x as defined by timepoints at which assessments were made. The time weighted change from baseline was calculated. A negative mean change from baseline indicates improvement in stiffness.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day -1), Day 2, Day 4, Day 7, Day 11, Day 14
outcome.population: FAS defined as all treated participants (etoricoxib or placebo) without major entry criteria violation and with at least one valid post-baseline primary efficacy assessment

group.title: ETOR 50 DMSO
group.description: Etoricoxib 50 mg (1.31 mL, 4% DMSO gel) applied topically twice daily to the affected knee for a period of 2 weeks.

group.title: Placebo (Pt 2)
group.description: Matching placebo to etoricoxib 50 mg 1.31 mL 4% DMSO gel applied topically twice daily to the affected knee for a period of 2 weeks.

measure.description: The WOMAC VA 3.1 Stiffness subscale is a self-administered questionnaire assessing lower extremity stiffness due to osteoarthritis that was completed by participants 2 to 3 hours post morning dose. The WOMAC Stiffness subscale had two questions with answers to each item assessed on a 100 mm VA scale (0 = no stiffness; 100 = extreme stiffness). The score for each item was summed and the overall score ranged from 0 to 200 (increasing severity). The time weighted average up to day x was calculated as the sum of rectangles under the curve for successive intervals prior to day x as defined by timepoints at which assessments were made. The time weighted change from baseline was calculated. A negative mean change from baseline indicates improvement in stiffness.

outcome.title: Study Part 2: Change From Baseline in Mean Participant Score on the WOMAC VA 3.1 Physical Functioning Scale
outcome.description: The WOMAC VA 3.1 Physical Functioning subscale is a self-administered questionnaire assessing lower extremity physical function due to osteoarthritis that was completed by participants 2 to 3 hours post morning dose. The WOMAC Physical Functioning subscale had 17 questions with answers to each item assessed on a 100 mm VA scale (0 = no difficulty; 100 = extreme difficulty). The score for each item was summed and the overall score ranged from 0 to 1700 (increasing severity). The time weighted average up to day x was calculated as the sum of rectangles under the curve for successive intervals prior to day x as defined by timepoints at which assessments were made. The time weighted change from baseline was calculated. A negative mean change from baseline indicates improvement in physical function.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day -1), Day 2, Day 4, Day 7, Day 11, Day 14
outcome.population: FAS defined as all treated participants (etoricoxib or placebo) without major entry criteria violation and with at least one valid post-baseline primary efficacy assessment

The time weighted average up to day x was calculated as the sum of rectangles under the curve for successive intervals prior to day x as defined by timepoints at which assessments were made. The model included terms of visit, visit-by-treatment, and treatment.

outcome.title: Study Part 2: Percentage of Participants by Category on Patient Global Assessment of Response to Therapy (PGART)
outcome.description: The PGART is a self-administered questionnaire completed by participants. Participant assessment of response of arthritis to study medication was assessed on a 5-point Likert scale ('very well', 'well', 'fair', 'poor', and 'very poor').
outcome.time_frame: Day 2, Day 4, Day 7, Day 11, Day 14, post-trial (up to Day 28)
outcome.population: FAS defined as all treated participants (etoricoxib or placebo) without major entry criteria violation and with at least one valid post-baseline primary efficacy assessment

group.title: ETOR 50 DMSO
group.description: Etoricoxib 50 mg (1.31 mL, 4% DMSO gel) applied topically twice daily to the affected knee for a period of 2 weeks.

group.title: Placebo (Pt 2)
group.description: Matching placebo to etoricoxib 50 mg 1.31 mL 4% DMSO gel applied topically twice daily to the affected knee for a period of 2 weeks.

measure.title: Study Part 2: Percentage of Participants by Category on Patient Global Assessment of Response to Therapy (PGART)
measure.description: The PGART is a self-administered questionnaire completed by participants. Participant assessment of response of arthritis to study medication was assessed on a 5-point Likert scale ('very well', 'well', 'fair', 'poor', and 'very poor').
measure.population: FAS defined as all treated participants (etoricoxib or placebo) without major entry criteria violation and with at least one valid post-baseline primary efficacy assessment

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment comparison of Day 2 PGART frequencies (ETOR 50 DMSO vs Placebo [Pt 2]) was performed using a two-sided Jonckheere-Terpstra test.
Treatment comparison of Day 4 PGART frequencies (ETOR 50 DMSO vs Placebo [Pt 2]) was performed using a two-sided Jonckheere-Terpstra test.
Treatment comparison of Day 7 PGART frequencies (ETOR 50 DMSO vs Placebo [Pt 2]) was performed using a two-sided Jonckheere-Terpstra test.
Treatment comparison of Day 11 PGART frequencies (ETOR 50 DMSO vs Placebo [Pt 2]) was performed using a two-sided Jonckheere-Terpstra test.
Treatment comparison of Day 14 PGART frequencies (ETOR 50 DMSO vs Placebo [Pt 2]) was performed using a two-sided Jonckheere-Terpstra test.
Treatment comparison of post-trial PGART frequencies (ETOR 50 DMSO vs Placebo [Pt 2]) was performed using a two-sided Jonckheere-Terpstra test.

outcome.title: Study Parts 1 and 2: Number of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event
outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.
outcome.time_frame: Study Part 1: up to Day 47; Study Part 2: up to Day 28
outcome.population: Safety analysis set defined as all treated participants (etoricoxib or placebo) based on the treatment received rather than the randomized assignment.

group.title: ETOR 75 DMSO
group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (1.97 mL) 4% DMSO gel applied topically.

group.title: ETOR 75 PG (Pt 1)
group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 75 mg (2.15 mL) 4% PG gel applied topically.

group.title: ETOR 150 DMSO (Pt 1)
group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (3.94 mL) 4% DMSO gel applied topically.

group.title: ETOR 150 PG (Pt 1)
group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 150 mg (4.30 mL) 4% PG gel applied topically.

group.title: ETOR OD (Pt 1)
group.description: Single-dose etoricoxib 163 mg (4.30 mL) 4% DMSO gel applied topically (DMSO formulation administered in overdose/error).

group.title: Placebo (Pt 1) (Deviation)
group.description: Single dose placebo (1.97 mL or 3.94 mL) gel applied topically (placebo gel administered in error instead of active study drug formulation).

group.title: ETOR 50 DMSO (Pt 2)
group.description: Etoricoxib 50 mg (1.31 mL, 4% DMSO gel) applied topically twice daily to the affected knee for a period of 2 weeks.

group.title: Placebo (Pt 2)
group.description: Matching placebo to etoricoxib 50 mg 1.31 mL 4% DMSO gel applied topically twice daily to the affected knee for a period of 2 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts or presentations regarding this trial 45 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the Sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission; this confidentiality does not include efficacy and safety results.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
